Introduction.Name: High Elves
Introduction.Description: The High Elves, or the Asur, as they call themselves, are one of the most ancient and powerful mortal civilisations within the Warhammer World. Hailing from a mighty mist-shrouded island-continent located within the centre of the Great Ocean, the High Elves of Ulthuan are a proud and mighty nation of masterful warriors, peerless mages and lords of the sky and sea. They are an ancient race with powerful armies and even grander magic, building a grand and all-mighty civilisation who, alongside the Dwarfs, fought a long-forgotten, apocalyptic war which saw some of the greatest and most powerful mortal heroes battle against the great darkness that tried to consume the world many thousands of years ago. At the zenith of their power, the world was truly theirs for the taking.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Striking
Artefact.Description: +1 to Hit

Artefact.Name: Sword of Battle
Artefact.Description: +1 Attack

Artefact.Name: Sword of Might
Artefact.Description: +1 Strenght

Artefact.Name: Biting Blade
Artefact.Description: -1 Armour save

Artefact.Name: Enchanted shield
Artefact.Description: 5+ Armour save

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Protection
Artefact.Description: 6+ ward save

Artefact.Name: Dispell Scroll
Artefact.Description: automatically dispel an enemy spell, one use only

Artefact.Name: Power Stone
Artefact.Description: +2 dice to cast a spell

Artefact.Name: Staff of Sorcery
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 to dispell
Artefact.Description: +1 to dispell

Artefact.Name: War Banner
Artefact.Description: +1 Combat Resolution

Artefact.Name: Pure of Heart
Artefact.Description: This Honour MUST be given to exactly one high Elf character. It costs no points.||The character, and any unit he joins, is Immune to Panic. If the Pure of Heart character is killed, the High Elf player loses 100 Victory points from his total at the end of the battle. If the scenario does not use Victory points then the demise of the Pure of Heart character has no effect.

Artefact.Name: Lion Guard
Artefact.Description: The character comes equipped with a lion cloak. The character and any unit he leads is Stubborn. If you have a character with Lion Guard, then White Lions become a Special Choice for your army (but remain 0-1).

Artefact.Name: Loremaster
Artefact.Description: The character is a Level 1 Wizard. Note that he may not cast spells if he is wearing armour (remember that barding for his steed will not affect his spell casting).

Artefact.Name: Swordmaster
Artefact.Description: The character is equipped with a Great weapon and may not take a magic weapon. Instead of striking last in any turn he does not charge, the character will strike in initiative order. The character also has the killing blow special rule.

Artefact.Name: Seer
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: May choose his spells instead of rolling for them
Artefact.Description: Mage only. May choose his spells instead of rolling for them.

Artefact.Name: Channeller
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: May cast with a maximum of +1 more Power dice than normal
Artefact.Description: Mage only. May cast with a maximum of +1 more Power dice than normal. For example, a Level 3 Mage may use up to five Power dice in an attempt to cast a spell (instead of the usual four).

Artefact.Name: Blade of Leaping Gold
Artefact.Description: The blade confers +3 Attacks on the character wielding it.

Artefact.Name: Bow of the Seafarer
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Resolve each bow hit like a single bolt from a Bolt Thrower
Artefact.Description: Treat the Bow of the Seafarer as a normal longbow with the following exception. Resolve a hit from this like a single bolt from a Bolt Thrower. Note that you may stand and shoot with the Bow of the Seafarer.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Hoeth
Artefact.Description: All hits wound automatically. Armour saves are modified by the Strength of the bearer.

Artefact.Name: Blade of Darting Steel
Artefact.Description: The wielder always strikes first, even if his opponent charged that turn. If both models have this ability, roll off to see who strikes first in each Close Combat phase. In addition, the wielder adds +1 to his rolls to hit.

Artefact.Name: Reaver bow
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Longbow with Strength 5, multiple shot x3
Artefact.Description: Treat the Reaver Bow as a normal longbow with the following exceptions: the bearer may shoot three times at the same target in each ot his Shooting phases and any hits are resolved at Strength 5.

Artefact.Name: Blade of Sea Gold
Artefact.Description: No armour saves may be taken against wounds caused by the Blade of Sea Gold.

Artefact.Name: Foe Bane
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: All hits on a target with 3 or more Wounds on its starting profile will always wound on a 2+
Artefact.Description: All hits on a target with 3 or more Wounds on its starting profile will always wound on a 2+. Armour saves are modified by the Strength of the bearer.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Protection
Artefact.Description: Counts as light armour (armour save 6+) which can be combined with other equipment normally. If the wearer fails his armour save he may make a 4+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Golden Shield
Artefact.Description: This shield confers a 6+ armour save which can be combined with other equipment normally. In addition, all attempts to hit the bearer in close combat suffer a penalty of -1.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Stars
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: After any unsaved wound model is instantly teleported 3D6" in a random direction
Artefact.Description: May only be worn by a model on foot. Counts as light armour (armour save 6+) which can be combined with other equipment normally. If the wearer suffers an unsaved wound then one of the gems will burst into brilliant white light as he is instantly teleported 3D6" in a random direction.||Note that this means that he can only suffer 1 unsaved wound in a round of close combat as he will be teleported away before the second can strike him. However, if he was struck by a Killing Blow or a weapon that does multiple wounds per hit (such as a cannon ball) then he would still suffer the instant death or multiplied wounds as normal before teleporting away.||If the model is teleported into another model or impassable terrain then simply carry on moving it along in the same direction until it is 1" beyond. If the model teleports off the table then treat it as having pursued off.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Heroes
Artefact.Description: Counts as heavy armour (armour save 5+) which can be combined with other equipment normally. In order to allocate close combat attacks against the wearer, an opponent must first pass a Leadership test. Test each Close Combat phase. If the test is failed, the enemy may attack another model in base contact instead. Models who are Immune to Psychology are immune to this effect also.

Artefact.Name: Shadow Armour
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Scout
Artefact.Description: Counts as heavy armour (armour save 5+) which can be combined with other equipment normally. In addition, if the wearer is an independent character on foot then he has the Scout special rule. He may choose to deploy either at the same rime as the other characters, or as a Scout (including setting up with a unit of Shadow Warriors).

Artefact.Name: Helm of Fortune
Artefact.Description: This helm confers a 6+ armour save which can be combined with other equipment normally. The wearer may re-roll failed armour saves.

Artefact.Name: Dragonscale Shield
Artefact.Description: This shield confers a 5+ armour save which can be combined with other equipment normally. Also gives the bearer a 6+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Vambraces of Defence
Artefact.Description: Gives the wearer a 4+ Ward save. In addition, the wearer may re-roll failed armour saves.

Artefact.Name: Golden Crown of Atrazar
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Discount the first unsaved wound
Artefact.Description: Discount the first wound suffered. One use only.

Artefact.Name: Loremaster's Cloak
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: 2+ Ward save against wounds caused by spells
Artefact.Description: Gives the wearer and the unit he is with a 2+ Ward save against wounds caused by spells. It has no effect against shooting or close combat attacks.

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Saphery
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: The magical weapons of enemy models will have no special effects whilst they are in base contact
Artefact.Description: The magical weapons of enemy models will have no special effects whilst they are in base contact with the bearer of the talisman. Treat the magic weapon as a normal one of its type, eg, a Sword of Battle would count as a hand weapon, Porko's Pigstikka would count as a spear, etc.

Artefact.Name: Sacred Incense
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: All shooting at the bearer or the unit he is with suffers a -1 to hit penalty
Artefact.Description: All shooting at the bearer or the unit he is with suffers a -1 to hit penalty.

Artefact.Name: Guardian Phoenix
Artefact.Description: Gives the wearer a 5+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Amulet of Fire
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Magic Resistance (1)
Cannot be harmed by Flaming Attacks
Artefact.Description: Gives the wearer Magic Resistance (1). In addition, the wearer cannot be harmed by fire-based attacks, eg, Skaven Watpfire Throwers, Dwarf Flame Cannons, or fire balls, etc.

Artefact.Name: Book of Hoeth
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Irresistible Force on any successful casting roll which includes any double, except a Miscast
Artefact.Description: Any spell cast by the mage with this book will be cast with Irresistible Force on any successful casting roll which includes any double, except a Miscast.

Artefact.Name: Annulian Crystal
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: During the enemy's Magic phase, the Crystal allows the High Elf player to remove one dice from the opponent's pile of Power dice and add it to his own Dispel dice pile
Artefact.Description: During the enemy's Magic phase, the Crystal allows the High Elf player to remove one dice from the opponent's pile of Power dice and add it to his own Dispel dice pile.

Artefact.Name: Starwood Staff
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 to all casting attempts
Artefact.Description: Gives +1 to all casting attempts made by the wizard carrying it.

Artefact.Name: Sigil of Asuryan
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Automatically dispels one enemy spell, in addition, roll a D6: on a 4+ the spell is destroyed and the casting Wizard cannot use it for the duration of the battle, one use only
Artefact.Description: Automatically dispels one enemy spell. In addition, roll a D6. On a 4+ the spell is destroyed and the casting Wizard cannot use it for the duration of the battle. One use only.

Artefact.Name: Staff of Solidity
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Mage immune to the effects of his first Miscast
Artefact.Description: This staff makes the Mage immune to the effects of his first Miscast. Note that a miscast spell still fails regardless of the actual dice score rolled.

Artefact.Name: Jewel of the Dusk
Artefact.Description: The jewel gives the Mage +1 Power dice in each of his own Magic phases. Only he may use this dice.

Artefact.Name: Silver Wand
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: One more spell than is normal for level
Artefact.Description: The wearer knows one more spell than is normal for his level.

Artefact.Name: Null Stone
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: No Wizard within 6" ot the hearer may cast any spells. No other magic item or rune item within 6" of the hearer will work
Artefact.Description: No Wizard within 6" ot the hearer may cast any spells. No other magic item or rune item within 6" of the hearer will work. Treat them as normal weapons, banners, etc, of the appropriate type. Note that this applies to all friendly wizards and magic items as well as enemy ones.

Artefact.Name: Healing Potion
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: May immediately restores all wounds lost at the start of any phase in either player's turn, one use only
Artefact.Description: The character or any character in base contact may drink this at the start of any phase in either player's turn. It immediately restores all wounds lost by the character during the battle so far. Obviously, if the character is dead at the start of the phase then he can't drink the potion. One use only.

Artefact.Name: Radiant Gem of Hoeth
Artefact.Description: The wearer counts as a Level 1 High Elf Mage. However, the wearer may still cast spells whilst wearing armour. This has no effect on characters who are already Wizards.

Artefact.Name: Cloak of Beards
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Dwarfs both Hate and Fear the wearer of the Cloak
Eeach model in base contact with the wearer loses all the runes from one of their runic items
Artefact.Description: Dwarfs both Hate and Fear the wearer of the Cloak. In addition, for the duration of each Close Combat phase, each model in base contact with the wearer loses all the runes from one of their runic items (determined randomly). Treat the item as a normal one of its kind.

Artefact.Name: Ring of Corin
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Bound spell, Power level 4, one use only: Vaul's Unmaking spell
Artefact.Description: Bound spell (Power level 4). One use only. The Ring of Corin may cast its Bound spell in the Magic phase like an ordinary spell. The spell requires no Power dice to cast, all the power required is provided by the ring itself. The Ring of Corin contains the Vaul's Unmaking spell.

Artefact.Name: Ring of Fury
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Bound spell, Power level 3: contains the Fury of Khaine spell
Artefact.Description: Bound spell (Power level 3). This ring may cast its Bound Spell once per Magic phase like an ordinary spell. The spell requires no Power dice to cast, all the power required is provided by the ring itself. The Ring of Fury contains the Fury of Khaine spell. After each use, even if it was dispelled, roll a D6. On a roll of a 1 the power of the Ring has been exhausted and it may not be used for the rest of the battle.

Artefact.Name: Blessed tome
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: All High Elf units within 6" get +1 Leadership
Artefact.Description: The character with the tome recites the stirring words of heroes of old as battle is joined. All High Elf units within 6" of the bearer get +1 Leadership (up to a maximum of 10).

Artefact.Name: Amulet of the Purifying Flame
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Spells that target the character or the unit he is with subtract -3 from their casting roll
Artefact.Description: Spells that target the character or the unit he is with subtract -3 from their casting roll. It has no effect on spells cast with Irresistible Force.

Artefact.Name: Battle Banner
Artefact.Description: The unit may add +D6 to the combat resolution of any close combat in which it is involved.

Artefact.Name: Banner of the World Dragon
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: The unit is completely immune to all spell effects, whatever their source
Artefact.Description: The unit is completely immune to all spell effects, whatever their source. This includes friendly spells, bound items, and spells with areas of effect that were cast on nearby units, etc. Spells which are cast on another unit, such as the Flaming Sword of Rhuin, will work as normal, as will all magic weapons used to attack them.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Sorcery
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +D3 Power dice to pile in each Magic phases
Artefact.Description: The banner adds +D3 Power dice to pile in each of your own Magic phases.

Artefact.Name: Standard of Balance
Artefact.Description: The unit carrying the Standard of Balance, and any enemy unit in base contact with it, is completely immune to all Psychology. Note that troops with frenzy lose it, just as if they had lost a round of combat.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Arcane Protection
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Magic Resistance (2)
Any Undead or Daemon model touching the unit will suffer 1 Wound (saves as normal) at the start of each of the bearer's Magic phases
Artefact.Description: The unit gets Magic Resistance (2). In addition, any Undead or Daemon model touching the unit carrying the banner will suffer 1 Wound (saves as normal) at the start of each of the bearer's Magic phases. Note that this does not count as a close combat attack.

Artefact.Name: Lion Standard
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Immune to fear and terror
Artefact.Description: The unit is immune to fear and terror.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Ellyrion
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: The unit treats difficult ground as open ground for purposes of movement
Artefact.Description: The unit treats difficult ground as open ground for purposes of movement.

Special.SpecialRuleDescription: No Dragons will fight Imrik, if they are in base contact with other models (and not in a challenge) then they light them instead, otherwise they may do nothing

HandWeapon.Name: Star Lance
HandWeapon.SpecialRuleDescription: On the turn he charges, Imrik gets +3 Strength with no armour saves allowed

Armour.Name: Armour of Caledor
Armour.SpecialRuleDescription: Immune to all breath and all Flaming attacks

Armour.Name: Dragonhorn
Armour.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per battle, at the start of any of his own turns, Imrik may sound the Dragonhorn: until the start of his next turn, all friendly High Elf units may re-roll any Leadership-based tests

Special.SpecialRuleDescription: Parries the first enemy hit against him per Close Combat phase and it has no effect
May re-roll any failed rolls to hit on the first turn of each close combat

HandWeapon.Name: Sunfang
HandWeapon.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per battle in his own Magic phase, Tyrion may use Sunfang to cast the bound spell Fury of Khaine (power level 6), the spell requires no Power dice to cast, all the power required is provided by Sunfang itself

Armour.Name: Dragon Armour of Aenarion
Armour.SpecialRuleDescription: Immune to all breath and all Flaming attacks

Armour.Name: Heart of Avelorn
Armour.SpecialRuleDescription: If Tyrion is slain, Heart of Avelorn returns Tyrion to life with 1 Wound, obviously it will only work once

Hero.Name: Teclis
Hero.Description: Teclis, High Loremaster of the White Tower

Special.SpecialRuleDescription: Any spell cast by Teclis will be cast with Irresistible Force on any successful casting roll which includes a double, except a Miscast
Use High Magic know all six spells, regardless ot his current level
May re-roll all dice for spell effects

Arcane.Name: The Moon Staff of Lileath
Arcane.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per battle, Moon Staff may granted D6 extra dice to cast, but no more additional dice for the rest of the battle

Arcane.Name: Scroll of Hoeth
Arcane.SpecialRuleDescription: One use only, same as Dispel scroll, in addition, both Teclis and the caster roll a D6: if Teclis scores higher, the spell cannot be reused by caster

Arcane.Name: The War Crown
Arcane.SpecialRuleDescription: Any spell which is normally limited to a specific range in inches is now of unlimited range

Option.Name: Dragon armour
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: Immune to all breath and all Flaming attacks

Option.Name: Dragon armour
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: Immune to all breath and all Flaming attacks

Special.SpecialRuleDescription: If Imrik is slain, will become subject to the rules for frenzy, but will otherwise remain under the control of the High Elf player
Fight in three ranks with spears
Fight in three ranks with spears

Armour.Name: Dragon armour
Armour.SpecialRuleDescription: Immune to all breath and all Flaming attacks
